main event: Several students at Hampton-Sydney College in Virginia observed an unusual glowing object in the sky on February 22, 1956.
interesting points: The object changed colors from red to green to blue and sometimes brilliant white.
A second object appeared off to the right side after the first one faded.
The objects were described as round, silver dollar-sized, and appeared to be hovering or vibrating.
The sightings lasted for around 45 minutes.
The witnesses included several students, one of whom had studied astronomy and did not believe it was a shooting star.
sighted object: round, glowing objects that changed color
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
